content.description: Figure 1. Pedigree of an inherited trait
content.question: Based on the pedigree in Figure 1, which of the following best explains the observed pattern of inheritance?

choices.label: The trait is autosomal dominant, because the cross between individuals <math alttext="1 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I-3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I-4</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced an affected offspring.

The trait is autosomal recessive, because the cross between individuals <math alttext="1 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I-1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I-2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced an affected offspring.

The trait is sex-linked dominant, because the cross between individuals <math alttext="2 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II-5</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II-6</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced an affected male.

The trait is sex-linked recessive, because the cross between individuals <math alttext="2 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II-2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II-3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced an affected female.

content.answer: The trait is autosomal recessive, because the cross between individuals <math alttext="1 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I-1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I-2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced an affected offspring.
